alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 2:43PM CDT until August 12 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Loudon County in east Tennessee... Knox County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Anderson County in east Tennessee... Northern Blount County in east Tennessee... Western Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Grainger County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 343 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles east of Clinton to 8 miles west of Maryville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Sevierville, Clinton, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Jefferson City, Loudon, and Gatlinburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 368 and 418. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 81 and 116. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Blount; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Sevier
